newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Belgians to get tax break for cycling to work.
newsitem.headline: Belgians to get tax break for cycling to work.

text.p: Belgians who cycle to work will get a tax break, matching that of drivers, following an agreement between parties in the majority centre-left government and environmentalist politicians.
From this year, employers will be allowed to pay their employees a tax-exempt six francs (16 cents) per kilometre for cycling to work, the same amount already allowed motorists.

"Up until now only driving to work by car was eligible for a fiscal stimulus," Hugo Van Dienderen, a parliamentarian for green party Agalev which launched the idea, told Reuters on Friday. Formal full parliament approval is due next Thursday.
Asked whether the greens had any plans to start a campaign against tax benefits for car users, he said: "This is just a first step." ($ = 35.67 Belgian Francs)
